title: Jane Remover Announces New Album, Shares Lead Single “JRJRJR”: Listen
description: Revengeseekerz is the singer-producer’s proper follow-up to 2023’s Census Designated
author: Walden Green
excerpt: Revengeseekerz is the singer-producer’s proper follow-up to 2023’s Census Designated
text: Jane Remover has announced a new album. Revengeseekerz is the singer-producer’s proper follow-up to 2023’s Census Designated. A release date and tracklist for the record, due out from DeadAir later this year, have not been shared yet. Lead single “JRJRJR” is out today, though, alongside a music video directed by Parker Corey. Watch it below.Throughout 2024, Jane Remover shared a string of one-off singles, including “Dream Sequence,” “Flash in the Pan,” “How to Teleport,” and “Magic I Want U.” This year, they’ll be releasing the album Ghostholding—recorded under their new Venturing moniker—on February 14, then hitting the road in the Spring for a run of North American dates billed as the Turn Up or Die Tour. Scroll down to see the full list of dates.Read about “Magic I Want U” at No. 10 on Pitchfork’s list of The 100 Best Songs of 2024.Jane Remover:04-23 Minneapolis, MN - 7th St Entry $*04-25 Chicago, IL - Lincoln Hall $*04-26 Detroit, MI - El Club $*04-27 Columbus, OH - Ace of Cups $*04-30 Toronto, Ontario - Velvet Underground $*05-02 Cambridge, MA - The Sinclair $*05-03 Brooklyn, NY - Music Hall of Williamsburg $*05-04 Philadelphia, PA - First Unitarian Church $*05-05 Washington, D.C. - The Atlantis $*05-07 Atlanta, GA - The Masquerade - Hell $*05-09 Houston, TX - White Oak Music Hall - Upstairs $*05-10 Austin, TX - Parish $*05-12 Denver, CO - Bluebird Theater $*05-13 Salt Lake City, UT - Kilby Court $*05-16 Seattle, WA - Neumos $^05-17 Vancouver, British Columbia - The Pearl $^05-18 Portland, OR - Hawthorne Theatre $^05-20 San Francisco, CA - The Independent $^05-21 Los Angeles, CA - El Rey Theatre $^05-22 Phoenix, AZ - Crescent Ballroom $^$ with Dazegxd* with D0llywood1^ with Lucy Bedroque
html:
Jane Remover has announced a new album. Revengeseekerz is the singer-producer’s proper follow-up to 2023’s Census Designated. A release date and tracklist for the record, due out from DeadAir later this year, have not been shared yet. Lead single “JRJRJR” is out today, though, alongside a music video directed by Parker Corey. Watch it below.

Throughout 2024, Jane Remover shared a string of one-off singles, including “Dream Sequence,” “Flash in the Pan,” “How to Teleport,” and “Magic I Want U.” This year, they’ll be releasing the album Ghostholding—recorded under their new Venturing moniker—on February 14, then hitting the road in the Spring for a run of North American dates billed as the Turn Up or Die Tour. Scroll down to see the full list of dates.

Read about “Magic I Want U” at No. 10 on Pitchfork’s list of The 100 Best Songs of 2024.

Jane Remover:

04-23 Minneapolis, MN - 7th St Entry $*
